intro: Hedycarya cunninghamii, commonly known as the mountain pepper, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, pinnate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in traditional bush tucker. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Hedycarya cunninghamii plays an important role in local ecosystems and has cultural significance among Indigenous communities.
